comments.content:
Some sort of OCR or something.

Hey, you didn't give us your credit card number & exp date so we could order software/fonts!

thank-you for your hints, patty....  
well, the one i have is only a fictitious c.c. number  
thanx anyway

They are created by a machine that doesn't use PC fonts. [Orator](http://web.archive.org/web/20150220005654/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Orator) is pretty good for these.

The H&FJ "Numbers" set has a couple that are similar too:  
 [http://www.typography.com/catalog/numbers/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150220005654/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/numbers/index.html "http://www.typography.com/catalog/numbers/index.html")
If you just want the look-and-feel: Ray Larabie created the font [Kredit](http://web.archive.org/web/20150220005654/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/kredit/)

dear all, thanks a lot for your suggestions.  
i will try them.
Renko, the font you linked to was just what I needed when I got to work this morning. Thanks!
Glad to help, Rik, even if it’s two years later … ;^D
